api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | BOOSEappDocumentation
api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a drawable canvas that supports drawing shapes, lines, moving pen position, wrtiting text and updating pen color. public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class with the specified dimensions. public AppCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int The width of the canvas, in pixels. Must be greater than 0. ysize int The height of the canvas, in pixels. Must be greater than 0. Remarks The canvas is initialized with a white background, a black pen, and a black brush. The initial drawing position is set to (0, 0). Properties PenColour This property is required by the ICanvas interface but is not used in AppCanvas. Colour changes are handled through SetColour(), so accessing this property will always throw a NotImplementedException. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Xpos Gets and sets the X-coordinate position. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Gets and sets the Y-Coordinate position. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle at the current pen position with the specified radius. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int Circle radius filled bool Whether Circle should be filled Clear() Clears the canvas to a white background and resets the pen position to (0,0). public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current pen position to the specified coordinates. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate of the target position. y int The y-coordinate of the target position. Remarks This method updates the current pen position to the specified coordinates after drawing the line. If the canvas, graphics context, or pen is not initialized, the method does nothing. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the Pen to the specified coordinates without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int New X coordinate y int New Y coordinate Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle at the current pen position with the specified width and height. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int Width of the rectangle height int Height of the rectangle filled bool Whether the rectangle should be filled Reset() Resets the object's position to its default state. public void Reset() Set(int, int) Resizes the drawing surface to the specified dimensions. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The new width of the drawing surface. Must be greater than 0. height int The new height of the drawing surface. Must be greater than 0. Remarks If either width or height is less than or equal to 0, the method does nothing. The method disposes of the previous drawing resources and creates new ones for the updated dimensions. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the pen and brush colour using RGB values. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int Red component (0–255) green int Green component (0–255) blue int Blue component (0–255) Tri(int, int) Draws an isosceles triangle within a bounding box defined by the specified width and height. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the bounding box. If negative, the triangle is drawn to the left of the current pen position. height int The height of the bounding box. If negative, the triangle is drawn above the current pen position. Remarks The triangle is drawn with its apex at the top center of the bounding box and its base spanning the bottom edge. The current pen position is used as the top-left corner of the bounding box. If either width or height is zero, no triangle is drawn. WriteText(string) Writes the specified text onto the canvas at a fixed position. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text to draw getBitmap() Retrieves the current bitmap object associated with the canvas. public object getBitmap() Returns object The bitmap object representing the canvas content, or null if no bitmap is available.
